    This Website

    Welcome!

    Welcome, developers! In this secret (shhh) part of the website you'll find some documentation on how the website works.

    Tip: You may want to bookmark this page so you can easily find it in the future

    Overview

    This website uses Jekyll, a static site generator. The site is hosted by GitHub Pages.

    Set Up for Local Testing

    Modifying the website, committing changes, and waiting for GitHub pages to regenerate the site is awfully slow. You should definitely set up Jekyll for local testing. As of now, Jekyll doesn't seem to support local testing on Windows machines.

    1. Install Ruby

    Visit the Jekyll installation page and follow the steps there.

    2. Install the Jekyll Gem

    Run the command:

    $ gem install jekyll bundler

    External Resources

    If you're unsure of where to begin, you should check out Jekyll.
